articles.title: Monster black hole M87 is spinning at 80% of the cosmic speed limit - and pulling in matter even faster
articles.description: The famous black hole M87 keeps surprising us. New research calculates its spin speed to be at 80% of the theoretical limit, with matter falling into its maw even faster.
articles.content: The monster black hole lurking at the center of galaxy M87 is an absolute beast. It is one of the largest in our vicinity and was the ideal first target for the Event Horizon Telescope. Scientists have taken a fresh look at the supermassive black hol... [3279 chars]

articles.title: Colombian presidential contender undergoes surgery after shooting
articles.description: A prominent Colombian right-wing presidential candidate who was shot during a campaign event in Bogota has successfully undergone initial surgery, the city's mayor said Sunday.

articles.title: Proposed bill to lower food prices up for Marcos' approval
articles.description: Romualdez said the bill is now set for enrollment and transmission to Malacañang for Marcos’ signature into law.
articles.content:
MANILA, Philippines — The proposed Livestock Development and Competitiveness Act, a measure that aims to lower food prices and expand livelihood opportunities, is now up for President Ferdinand Marcos Jr, according to House Speaker Martin Romualdez.

articles.title: When seizures take over your life - the story of a 12-year-old boy battling multiple seizures
articles.description: Yusuf's journey from multiple seizures to a tumor diagnosis and successful treatment, highlighting the importance of early detection and intervention.
articles.content: A 12-year-old boy from Yemen, named Yusuf, was suffering from multiple seizures every single day for a very long time. He was placed on 7 to 8 anti-epileptic medicines and was unable to walk, go to school, and even do simple tasks without help. His c... [5391 chars]

articles.title: Kemi Badenoch says she does not speak to women in burqas at constituency surgery
articles.description: Tory leader says women can wear what they like, but that she asks people who attend her surgery to remove face coverings
articles.content:
Kemi Badenoch has said she will not speak to women wearing burqas in her constituency surgery, and argued that employers should be able to ban their staff from wearing face coverings.

articles.title: A New Law of Nature Attempts to Explain the Complexity of the Universe
articles.description: A novel suggestion that complexity increases over time, not just in living organisms but in the nonliving world, promises to rewrite notions of time and evolution.
articles.content: Together with the chemist Lee Cronin of the University of Glasgow, Sara Walker of Arizona State University has devised an alternative set of ideas to describe how complexity arises, called assembly theory. In place of functional information, assembly... [3762 chars]

articles.title: Pope Leo condemns 'exclusionary mindset' in Pentecost address
articles.description: Pope Leo's choice of language was significant, encouraging people to "open borders" within their hearts and minds.
articles.content:
VATICAN — Pope Leo XIV exhorted the faithful on Sunday to reject an “exclusionary mindset” he said had led to nationalism around the world.
